page.title: 11Outside Weare Church
page.content: St.Gregory's church is situated on the edge of the village of Weare in Somerset.It was built about 500 years ago.Over the ages houses have been built around it. The oldest houses are nearest the church. The church is set on a slight hill and is surrounded by gravestones. The oldest gravestone is dated 1570. Many of the names on the gravestones are the same, the most common being Day and Ham. The church itself is built of stone and the walls are about 70cm thick. The main door is arched and made of very thick oak. The church has a tall perpendicular tower with a golden weathercock on top. It also has a flagpole where the Union Jack is flown on special days. Around the top of the tower are 8 gargoyles. These are to help the water escape from the flat tower roof. (Cont on page 12)
